config.question: Which of the following was one of the ways in which John Locke’s Two Treatises of Government (1690) seemed to give a theoretical basis to what was American political practice?

choices.content: He stated that all people possessed natural and inalienable rights.
He wrote eloquently about the evils of parliamentary sovereignty.
He wrote with great detail and clarity about the role of women in a civil society.
He stated emphatically that there should be no taxation without representation.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Locke held that the agreements between men were the foundation of human society and civil government and were instrumental in preserving God-given rights. Locke justified rebellion against arbitrary government that was by its very nature unreasonable. Americans delighted in Locke’s ability to unite traditional Protestant religious values with a spirited defense of popular government. See L.O. 5.1 Why did Americans resist parliamentary taxation?
